item.title: 米莱在关键的美国之行前陷入加密货币 Memecoin 丑闻
item.description: 周五深夜，多产的社交媒体用户哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）将追随者引向一个网站，该网站声称使用加密货币为阿根廷的小企业筹集资金。【原文：Late Friday night, prolific social media user Javier Milei directed followers to a site that purported to raise money for small businesses in Argentina using crypto.】

item.title: 日本保险公司在计划实施前出售 110 亿美元交叉持有股票
item.description: 在政策制定者推动减持交叉持股后，日本三大非寿险公司在去年 4 月至 12 月期间共出售了 1.64 万亿日元（110 亿美元）的交叉持股。【原文：Japan’s three biggest non-life insurers sold a combined ¥1.64 trillion ($11 billion) of cross-held shares in the April-December period last year, following a push by policymakers to reduce such holdings.】

item.title: 贸易风险隐现，2024 年泰国经济增长令人失望
item.description: 2024 年泰国的经济增长弱于预期，继续落后于邻国，今年面临着全球贸易政策障碍和国内需求疲软带来的风险。【原文：Thailand’s economic growth was weaker-than-expected in 2024 and continued to lag its neighbors as it faces a year fraught with risks from global trade policy hurdles and sluggish domestic demand.】

item.title: 高盛上调 MSCI 中国目标，DeepSeek 展望改善
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Strategists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. expect a blistering rally in Chinese equities to continue, as the emergence of DeepSeek sparks optimism over the country’s technological advancements.】

item.title: DeepSeek 试验开始后腾讯股价触及三年新高
item.description: 腾讯控股有限公司（Tencent Holdings Ltd.）的股价升至自 2021 年以来的最高点，因为该公司的微信社交媒体平台首次推出了人工智能服务 DeepSeek。【原文：Tencent Holdings Ltd.’s shares rose to their highest since 2021 after DeepSeek, the AI service that’s shaken up the industry since its emergence this year, debuted on the big tech company’s WeChat social media platform.】

item.title: 黄金守住 12 月以来最大跌幅，市场担忧涨势已过
item.description: 黄金在创下两个月来最大单日跌幅后止跌企稳，投资者担心黄金近期破纪录的涨势可能已经过头。【原文：Gold steadied following its largest one-day decline in two months, with the slump sparked by investor concern that the metal’s recent record-breaking rally may have been overdone.】

item.title: 自 2021 年以来资产管理公司最看好日元，因押注日本央行加息
item.description: 随着市场对日本央行将再次加息的猜测不断升温，机构投资者对日元的看法出现了自 2021 年 3 月以来最积极的转变。【原文：Institutional investors turned the most positive on the yen since March 2021 as speculation mounts that the Bank of Japan will raise interest rates again.】

item.title: 日本 Topix 指数因盈利提升而上涨，汽车关税担忧抑制涨幅
item.description: 由于三丽鸥（Sanrio）等公司的季度盈利好于预期，抵消了唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发表最新言论后美国可能对汽车制造商征收新关税的担忧，日本股指上扬。【原文：Japan’s broader Topix index edged up as better-than-expected quarterly earnings from companies like Sanrio lifted sentiment, offsetting worries about potential new US tariffs on automakers after Donald Trump’s latest comments.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡预算力求在民意调查承诺与国际货币基金组织要求之间取得平衡
item.description: 斯里兰卡总统阿努拉-库马拉-迪萨纳亚克（Anura Kumara Dissanayake）将需要在周一的预算案中走钢丝，既要设法减轻穷人的经济负担，又要采取措施使国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）的 30 亿美元救助计划按计划进行。【原文：Sri Lanka President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will need to walk a tightrope in his budget Monday, seeking to reduce the economic burden on the poor while taking steps to keep a $3 billion International Monetary Fund bailout on track.】

item.title: 新西兰经济疲软离境人数创新高
item.description: 高昂的生活费用和严重的经济衰退促使人们到海外寻找机会，去年离开新西兰的人数创下了历史新高。【原文：A record number of people left New Zealand last year as high living costs and a deep recession prompted them to seek opportunities overseas.】

item.title: 中国放缓而非停止铜冶炼的高速增长
item.description: 中国政府正在认真限制铜冶炼厂的盲目扩张，尽管其新政策可能会暂停而非停止发展。【原文：The Chinese government is getting serious about constraining the blind expansion of copper smelters, although its new policy is likely to pause rather than stop development.】

item.title: 在印花税上调之前，伦敦面临英国最严重的房屋销售困局
item.description: Rightmove 表示，由于买家和卖家都急于在房产税上调生效前完成交易，伦敦面临着英国最大的房屋销售瓶颈。【原文：London faces the biggest bottlenecks of house sales in the UK as buyers and sellers rush to complete deals before a property tax increase comes into force, Rightmove said.】

item.title: 日本经济表现优于预期，使日本央行继续步入正轨
item.description: 日本经济表现超出预期，商业支出和净贸易额连续第三个季度实现增长，这将使日本央行继续保持进一步加息的势头。日元走强。【原文：Japan’s economy outperformed forecasts as business spending and net trade helped fuel a third straight quarter of growth that will keep the Bank of Japan on track for further interest rate hikes. The yen strengthened.】

item.title: 伊拉克和俄罗斯的石油供应量有望增加，导致石油价格下滑
item.description: 由于伊拉克和俄罗斯的石油流量有望增加，石油价格走低，市场指数显示出供应过剩的疲软迹象。【原文：Oil edged lower on the prospect of increased flows from Iraq and Russia, with market gauges flashing signs of weakness on the likelihood of oversupply.】

item.title: DeepSeek 叩响警钟后，交易员纷纷涌入香港期权市场
item.description: 蛇年伊始，香港期权市场表现强劲。【原文：The year of the snake has started strong for Hong Kong’s options market.】

item.title: 习马会被视为中国股市大涨的下一个催化剂
item.description: 在科技股大涨之后，国家主席习近平和电子商务偶像马云本周可能会面，这可能成为中国股市延续涨势的下一个催化剂。【原文：A potential encounter this week between President Xi Jinping and e-commerce icon Jack Ma, coming after a blistering run by tech shares, could be the next catalyst to extend the rally in China’s stocks.】

item.title: Michael Burry 在 DeepSeek 推动的反弹前削减了一些中国科技股的赌注
item.description: 就在 DeepSeek 公司在人工智能领域取得突破性进展，再次引发中国股价上涨 1.3 万亿美元之前，迈克尔-伯利（Michael Burry）撤回了对中国科技股的部分投资。【原文：Michael Burry rolled back on some of his investments in Chinese tech stocks just before DeepSeek’s breakthrough in artificial intelligence reignited a $1.3 trillion rally in the country’s shares.】

item.title: 中国对人工智能持乐观态度，亚洲股市上扬：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市上涨，原因是人工智能乐观情绪提振了香港和中国的科技股，而其他投资者则因美国和欧盟在关税和乌克兰战争问题上的紧张关系而保持谨慎。【原文：Asian stocks gained as AI optimism boosted tech shares in Hong Kong and China, while other investors remained cautious due to tensions between the US and European Union over tariffs and the war in Ukraine.】

item.title: 美元波动推动日元多头在欧洲进行创新交易
item.description: 在主要经济体利率走势出现分化的情况下，投资者的押注方式变得越来越有创意，他们想方设法避开美元的波动，转而利用欧洲货币为日元押注提供资金。【原文：Investors are getting creative in the way they bet on the diverging path for interest rates across major economies as they look for ways to sidestep volatility in the dollar, using European currencies instead to fund bets on the Japanese yen.】

item.title: 违约的中国企业在法庭审理中面临风险
item.description: 随着一些陷入困境的公司面临清算的风险上升，本周在香港，陷入困境的中国公司正面临着大量的法庭听证会。【原文：Distressed Chinese companies are facing a torrent of court hearings in Hong Kong this week, as the risk of liquidation rises for some beleaguered firms.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 贸易战和供应困境正将一揽子大宗商品推向两年多来的最高水平。铜市对关税威胁作出了反应。南美的干旱抑制了全球玉米库存的前景。【原文：Trade wars and supply woes are pushing a basket of commodities to the highest levels in more than two years. Copper markets are having a reaction to threats of tariffs. And South American dryness has curbed the outlook for the world’s corn stockpiles.】

item.title: 西太平洋银行称借款人财务状况在澳大利亚央行降息前有所改善
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的银行之一称，其客户的不良贷款进一步下降，即使在央行周二预期下调借贷成本之前也是如此。【原文：One of Australia’s largest banks said bad loans among its customers fell further, even before an expected cut to borrowing costs by the central bank on Tuesday.】

item.title: 日本央行卸载股票，将重点转向 ETF 持股
item.description: 日本央行将比原定计划提前完成卸载其在二十年前金融危机期间从受困银行手中购买的数百万美元股票的工作，这一进展使其持有的规模更大的交易所交易基金的命运成为焦点。【原文：The Bank of Japan is on course to finish offloading millions of dollars of stocks that it bought from beleaguered banks during the financial crisis two decades ago sooner than scheduled, a development that throws into focus the fate of its considerably larger holdings of exchange-traded funds.】

item.title: 西太平洋银行股价下跌，原因是利润下滑，利润率令人担忧
item.description: 西太平洋银行（Westpac Banking Corp.）首席执行官安东尼-米勒（Anthony Miller）表示，澳大利亚经济的高生活成本继续削弱客户的消费能力，在利润和利润率下滑之后，该公司股价下跌达 6%。【原文：Westpac Banking Corp.’s shares declined as much as 6% after profit and margins slipped and Chief Executive Officer Anthony Miller said the high cost of living in the Australian economy continues to bite into customers’ spending power.】

item.title: a2 牛奶公司因中国需求提高收入预期，股价上涨
item.description: 新西兰婴儿配方奶粉分销商 a2 Milk 上半年盈利增长，并首次宣布派发股息，尽管整体市场萎缩，但该公司在中国的销售额仍有所增长，此后该公司股价大涨。【原文：Shares of a2 Milk jumped after the New Zealand infant formula distributor boosted first-half earnings and declared a dividend for the first time as sales in China grew despite the overall market shrinking.】

item.title: 阿拉伯支持中东全球倡议，重点关注叙利亚
item.description: 中东国家、国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）和其他主要全球金融机构正带头做出前所未有的努力，帮助该地区 "受冲突影响 "的国家恢复经济，重点是叙利亚。【原文：Middle East countries, the International Monetary Fund and other major global financial institutions are spearheading an unprecedented effort to help “conflict-affected” countries in the region recover, with a focus on Syria.】

item.title: 对冲基金熊市面临被坚挺澳元烧毁的风险
item.description: 对冲基金看跌澳元的头寸面临亏损的危险，因为很多负面消息可能已经出现在澳元的价格中。【原文：Hedge funds are in danger of losing money on their bearish Australian dollar positions as a lot of the negative news may already be in the currency’s price.】
